template<T >
virtual double SimulatedAnnealing.SimulatedAnnealing< T >.AcceptanceProbabilityFunction ( double  currentEnergy,
double  newEnergy,
double  temperature 
) [protected, virtual]

The acceptance probability function - specifies the probability of making the transition from the current state s to a candidate new state s'.

Can be overriden.

Parameters:
currentEnergy The current (internal) energy of the system.
newEnergy The new (internal) energy of the system.
temperature The temperature of the system.
Returns:
The probability that a transition from the current state of the system to the new state of the system will be accepted.

template<T >
bool SimulatedAnnealing.SimulatedAnnealing< T >.IsAcceptableSolutionFound ( double  acceptableEnergy  ) 

Is acceptable solution found?

Parameters:
acceptableEnergy The acceptable energy (i.e. energy sufficiently low (when minimizing) or sufficiently high (when maximizing)).
Returns:
True if an acceptable solution is found, false otherwise.

The perturbation (a.k.a. neighbour) function - generates a randomly chosen neighbour of a given state.
